title: Incumbent Senators are likely to be reelected

content.question: Which of the following statements about incumbent senators running for reelection is correct?

choices.label: The senators with the best chances of reelection are those who have served the longest.
The amount of money spent by a challenger has little bearing on an incumbent's reelection chances.
Incumbent senators are less likely to be reelected than are incumbent members of the House of Representatives.
An incumbent senator is equally likely to be reelected or defeated.
The most important factor influencing the reelection chances of senators is whether they belong to the President's party.

content.answer: Incumbent senators are less likely to be reelected than are incumbent members of the House of Representatives.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
